title: Dominican Republic: Citi Launches 12th Annual Microentrepreneurship Awards
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - Citi and Consejo de Fundaciones Americanas de Desarrollo (Solidarios) are partnering to offer the 12th annual edition of the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, recognizing micro, small and medium-sized enterprises that have made an impact by serving as agents for change within their communities.
tag-1: Dominican Republic: Citi Launches 12th Annual Microentrepreneurship Awards
tag-3: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – Citi and Consejo de Fundaciones Americanas de Desarrollo (Solidarios) are partnering to offer the 12th annual edition of the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, recognizing micro, small and medium-sized enterprises that have made an impact by serving as agents for change within their communities.
tag-4: The judging panel that will evaluate this year's award nominees includes Carolina Ramos of Banco Central; Ignacio Méndez, an official with the Ministry of Industry and Commerce; Marina Ortiz of Fondo para el Financiamiento de la Microempresa; Jesús Geraldo Martínez, representing the Superintendency of Banking; Yokasta Guzmán, of the State Hiring Office; Rafael Blanco, of the National Private Sector Council; and media personality Jatnna Tavárez.
tag-5: As every year, microfinance institutions will nominate candidates for the award from among their clients. To participate, nominees must describe their personal histories and business project, and submit photos of themselves at work. Awards will be offered in six categories: Microentrepreneurial Initiative of the Year, Environmental Protection and Improvement, Family-run Microenterprise, Agriculture and Livestock, Education and Young Entrepreneurs. A grand prize will recognize the Microenterprise of the Year.
tag-6: Offering these awards is a way for Citi to reaffirm its commitment to entrepreneurial development and opportunity, with a special focus on low-income young people, the beneficiaries of a number of Citi initiatives including the Citi Foundation's "Pathways to Progress."
tag-7: At the launch event, Citi and Solidarios explained that in recognition of strong growth prospects in the production sector, this year's awards emphasize financial education oriented toward retirement planning and business management. Other main themes will include tailoring financial advice to the needs of individual entrepreneurs and expanding access to basic accounting tools.
tag-8: Representatives of both organizations also listed some of the challenges facing microfinance today, among them persuading governments to participate in microfinance projects as strategic partners in supervising regulatory issues, selecting the right financing channels, and simplified branch management. They concluded by calling for more efficient processes and new formats for generating and providing credit and financial services, as well as management and technology skills training.
tag-9: According to Máximo Vidal, CCO of Citi Dominican Republic, "micro, small and medium-sized enterprises represent 96 percent of the country's businesses and embody the entrepreneurial spirit, courage and perseverance that characterize Dominicans. Microenterprises generate nearly 1.5 million jobs in this country, generating the income that an equal number of households rely on to follow their dreams and build their own future through honest, honorable work based on solid values."
tag-10: To this end, the 2016 Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards are designed to promote the development of a series of values identified as being key to entrepreneurial growth: vision, good management, family unity, responsibility, dedication, quality production, customer service and innovation.
tag-11: "We consider the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards to be an initiative that rewards microenterprise in the Dominican Republic," noted Ignacio Méndez Vice Minister for SMEs at the Ministry of Industry and Commerce. "As such, they are very important to us, because managerial capabilities and financial skills tend to be areas of weakness for microenterprises. By rewarding good performance, these awards help promote improved management and administration."
tag-12: Citi has offered the Microentrepreneurship Awards since 2005. It will offer the program in 28 countries around the world this year, including the Dominican Republic, with the support of the Citi Foundation.
